trans-unit.source: Represents a standard Windows track bar.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> is a scrollable control similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar> control.

You can configure ranges through which the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property of a track bar scrolls by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> property to specify the lower end of the range and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> property to specify the upper end of the range.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A> property defines the increment to add or subtract from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property when clicks occur on either side of the scroll box.
The track bar can be displayed horizontally or vertically.
You can use this control to input numeric data obtained through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property.
You can display this numeric data in a control or use it in code.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> is created with a default horizontal orientation and a range of 0 to 10, with a tick mark shown for every value.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height or width of the track bar is being automatically sized.
You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.AutoSize%2A> property to `true` to cause the track bar to adjust its height (if horizontally aligned) or width (if vertically aligned).
The height or width is adjusted to a standard size based on the screen resolution on which the track bar is displayed.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.AutoSize%2A> property to `false` if you want to adjust the size yourself.
`true` if the track bar is being automatically sized; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.AutoSize"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the background image for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BackgroundImage%2A> property has no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control; therefore, it is hidden in the designer and from IntelliSense.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> that is the background image for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BackgroundImage"></xref> property changes.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BackgroundImage%2A> property has no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control; therefore, it is hidden in the designer and from IntelliSense.
Gets or sets an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout"></xref> value; however, setting this property has no effect on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BackgroundImageLayout%2A> property will have no effect on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control; therefore, this property is not shown in the designer or by IntelliSense.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout"></xref> values.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BackgroundImageLayout"></xref> property changes.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BackgroundImageLayout%2A> property will have no effect on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control; therefore, this property is no shown in the designer or by Intellisense.
Begins the initialization of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> that is used on a form or used by another component.
The initialization occurs at run time.
The [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] design environment uses this method to start the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.EndInit%2A> method ends the initialization.
Using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.EndInit%2A> methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.
Occurs when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateHandle"></xref> method.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateParams"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.
Gets a value indicating the mode for the Input Method Editor (IME) for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref>.
Always <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode.Disable"></xref>.
Gets the default size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref>.
The default width is 104 pixels; the height will vary.
You can override this property in a derived class to provide a different default size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> representing the default size of the control.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether this control should redraw its surface using a secondary buffer to reduce or prevent flicker; however, this property has no effect on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control
Setting this property has no effect on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control; therefore, it is not shown in the designer or by IntelliSense.
`true` if the control has a secondary buffer; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the user double-clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control.
Ends the initialization of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> that is used on a form or used by another component.
The initialization occurs at run time.
The [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] design environment uses this method to end the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BeginInit%2A> method starts the initialization.
Using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.EndInit%2A> methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.
Overrides <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Font"></xref>
This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to the text displayed by the control.
The default is the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultFont"></xref> property.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Font"></xref> property changes.
Gets the foreground color of the track bar.
Always <xref href="System.Drawing.SystemColors.WindowText"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.ForeColor"></xref> property changes.
Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode"></xref> values.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.ImeMode"></xref> property changes.
Determines whether the specified key is a regular input key or a special key that requires preprocessing.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values.
`true` if the specified key is a regular input key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value to be added to or subtracted from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value"></xref> property when the scroll box is moved a large distance.

When the user presses the PAGE UP or PAGE DOWN key or clicks the track bar on either side of the scroll box, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property changes according to the value set in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A> property.

You might consider setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A> value to a percentage of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> (for a vertically oriented track bar) or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> (for a horizontally oriented track bar) value.
This keeps the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.
A numeric value.
The default is 5.
The assigned value is less than 0.
Gets or sets the upper limit of the range this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> is working with.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SetRange%2A> method to set both the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> properties at the same time.
The maximum value for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref>.
The default is 10.
Gets or sets the lower limit of the range this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> is working with.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SetRange%2A> method to set both the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> properties at the same time.
The minimum value for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref>.
The default is 0.
Occurs when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control.
Occurs when the user double-clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColorChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Use the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnHandleCreated(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseWheel"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.RightToLeftLayoutChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll"></xref> event.
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.OnScroll%2A> event to update other controls as the position of the scroll box changes.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.OnScroll%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.SystemColorsChanged"></xref> event.
The control will redraw when the system colors change.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.OnSystemColorsChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.ValueChanged"></xref> event.
The <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets or sets a value indicating the horizontal or vertical orientation of the track bar.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Orientation%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Orientation?displayProperty=fullName>, the scroll box moves from left to right as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> increases.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Orientation%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Orientation?displayProperty=fullName>, the scroll box moves from bottom to top as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> increases.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Orientation"></xref> values.
The assigned value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Orientation"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the space between the edges of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control and its contents.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Padding%2A> property has no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control; therefore, it is hidden in the designer and from IntelliSense.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> object.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Padding"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control is drawn.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> will be laid out from right to left.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.RightToLeftLayout%2A> property is used with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeft%2A> property for international applications where the language is written from right to left, such as Hebrew or Arabic.
`true` if the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> are laid out from right to left; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.RightToLeftLayout"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Example
Occurs when either a mouse or keyboard action moves the scroll box.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Performs the work of setting the specified bounds of this control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Left"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Top"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height"></xref> property value of the control.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified"></xref> values.
Sets the minimum and maximum values for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref>.
You can use this method to set the entire range for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> at the same time.
To set the minimum or maximum values individually, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> properties.
If the `minValue` parameter is greater than the `maxValue` parameter, `maxValue` is set equal to `minValue`.
The lower limit of the range of the track bar.
The upper limit of the range of the track bar.
Gets or sets the value added to or subtracted from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value"></xref> property when the scroll box is moved a small distance.

When the user presses one of the arrow keys, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property changes according to the value set in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> property.

You might consider setting the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> to a percentage of the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> (for a vertically oriented track bar) or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> (for a horizontally oriented track bar) property.
This sets the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.
A numeric value.
The default value is 1.
The assigned value is less than 0.
Gets or sets the text of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref>.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The text associated with this control.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Text"></xref> property changes.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the delta between ticks drawn on the control.

For a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> with a large range of values between the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> properties, it might be impractical to draw all the ticks for values on the control.
For example, if you have a control with a range of 100, passing in a value of 5 here causes the control to draw 20 ticks.
In this case, each tick represents five units in the range of values.
The numeric value representing the delta between ticks.
The default is 1.
Gets or sets a value indicating how to display the tick marks on the track bar.
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickStyle%2A> property to modify the manner in which the tick marks are displayed on the track bar.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TickStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TickStyle.BottomRight"></xref>.
The assigned value is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TickStyle"></xref>.
Returns a string that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.ToString%2A> method returns a string that includes the type and the values for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> properties.
A string that represents the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar"></xref>.
Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property contains the number that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.
A numeric value that is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum"></xref> range.
The default value is 0.
The assigned value is less than the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum"></xref>.
-or-
The assigned value is greater than the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value"></xref> property of a track bar changes, either by movement of the scroll box or by manipulation in code.
You can use this event to update other controls when the value represented in the track bar changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)"></xref> method.
A Windows Message object.
